intro: Euryops oligoglossus subsp. oligoglossus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bushveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
